material.mattext: Try to (wrongly) apply the addition rule for disjoint events to P(D1 or D2), and explain why the answer you got proves that the addition rule for disjoint events does not work in general.

If we WRONGLY apply the addition rule for disjoint events in order to find P(D1 or D2) we'll get: P(D1 or D2) = P(D1) + P(D2) = .86 + .54 = 1.4 The answer is wrong for certain(!) since we got a probability that is greater than 1. This proves the danger of incorrectly applying the addition rule for disjoint events when it is NOT appropriate to do so.
